<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 3%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At September&#160;7, 2010, there were 51,781,740 shares of the
    registrant&#146;s common stock, par value $0.01 per share,
    outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 3%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Exchangeable and Special Voting Shares</I>:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 3%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At September&#160;7, 2010, there were outstanding 19,110,042
    exchangeable shares of Lulu Canadian Holding, Inc., a
    wholly-owned subsidiary of the registrant. Exchangeable shares
    are exchangeable for an equal number of shares of the
    registrant&#146;s common stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 3%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, at September&#160;7, 2010, the registrant had
    outstanding 19,110,042 shares of special voting stock, through
    which the holders of exchangeable shares of Lulu Canadian
    Holding, Inc. may exercise their voting rights with respect to
    the registrant. The special voting stock and the
    registrant&#146;s common stock generally vote together as a
    single class on all matters on which the common stock is
    entitled to vote.
</DIV>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">lululemon
    athletica inc. and Subsidiaries<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">


    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times"><!-- XBRL,op --><A name='104'>CONSOLIDATED
    STATEMENTS OF OPERATIONS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times"><!-- XBRL,body --></FONT></B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(Amounts
    in thousands, except per share amounts)</FONT></A>
</DIV>
</A>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="41%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="9%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="9%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<!-- XBRL,ns -->
<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">lululemon
    athletica inc. and Subsidiaries<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">


    <A name='107'><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    THE UNAUDITED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    </A><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(Amounts
    in thousands, except per share and store count information,
    unless otherwise indicated)
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 05 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;1.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NATURE OF
    OPERATIONS AND BASIS OF PRESENTATION</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Nature
    of operations</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    lululemon athletica inc., a Delaware corporation
    (&#147;lululemon&#148; and, together with its subsidiaries
    unless the context otherwise requires, the &#147;Company&#148;)
    is engaged in the design, manufacture and distribution of
    healthy lifestyle inspired athletic apparel, which is sold
    through a chain of corporate-owned and operated retail stores,
    direct to consumer through
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce,</FONT>
    through independent franchises and through a network of
    wholesale accounts. The Company&#146;s primary markets are
    Canada, the United States and Australia, where 45, 71 and 10
    corporate-owned stores were in operation as of August&#160;1,
    2010, respectively. There were 126 and 110 corporate-owned
    stores in operation as of August&#160;1, 2010 and
    January&#160;31, 2010, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Basis
    of presentation</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The unaudited interim consolidated financial statements as of
    August&#160;1, 2010 and for the thirteen and twenty-six weeks
    ended August&#160;1, 2010 and August&#160;2, 2009 are presented
    using the United States dollar and have been prepared by the
    Company under the rules and regulations of the Securities and
    Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;). In the opinion of
    management, the financial information is presented in accordance
    with United States generally accepted accounting principles
    (&#147;GAAP&#148;) for interim financial information and,
    accordingly, do not include all of the information and footnotes
    required by GAAP for complete financial statements. The
    financial information as of January&#160;31, 2010 is derived
    from the Company&#146;s audited consolidated financial
    statements and notes for the fiscal year ended January&#160;31,
    2010, included in Item&#160;8 in the Company&#146;s fiscal 2009
    Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
    These unaudited interim consolidated financial statements
    reflect all adjustments which are in the opinion of management
    necessary to a fair statement of the results for the interim
    periods presented. These unaudited interim consolidated
    financial statements should be read in conjunction with the
    Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements and related
    notes included in the Company&#146;s fiscal 2009 Annual Report
    on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    filed with the SEC on March&#160;25, 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company&#146;s fiscal year ends on the Sunday closest to
    January 31 of the following year, typically resulting in a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">52-week</FONT>
    year, but occasionally giving rise to an additional week,
    resulting in a 53-week year. Fiscal 2010 will end on
    January&#160;30, 2011 and will be a 52&#160;week year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company&#146;s business is affected by the pattern of
    seasonality common to most retail apparel businesses. The
    results for the periods presented are not necessarily indicative
    of future financial results.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 05 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;2.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SUMMARY
    OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    United States income taxes and foreign withholding taxes are not
    provided for on undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries
    which are considered to be indefinitely reinvested in the
    operations of such subsidiaries. The amount of these earnings
    was approximately $117,387 and $110,849 at August&#160;1, 2010
    and January&#160;31, 2010, respectively. The Company recorded a
    deferred tax liability of $5,284 in the first two quarters of
    fiscal 2010 for the estimated future income taxes and foreign
    withholding taxes attributable to the undistributed earnings of
    foreign subsidiaries for which it does not have plans for
    reinvestment in the operations of such subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Recent
    accounting pronouncements</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In February 2010, the Financial Accounting Standards Board
    (&#147;FASB&#148;) amended Accounting Standards Codification
    (&#147;ASC&#148;) Topic 855 <I>Subsequent Events </I>(&#147;ASC
    855&#148;). Under the amended guidance, SEC filers are no longer
    required to disclose the date through which subsequent events
    have been evaluated in originally issued and revised financial
    statements. This guidance was effective immediately and the
    Company adopted these new requirements in the first quarter of
    fiscal 2010.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    7
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">lululemon
    athletica inc. and Subsidiaries</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>NOTES&#160;TO THE UNAUDITED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In April 2010, the FASB amended ASC Topic 718 <I>Compensation
    </I>(&#147;ASC 718&#148;) to clarify that a share-based payment
    award with an exercise price denominated in the currency of a
    market in which a substantial portion of the entity&#146;s
    equity securities trades should not be considered to contain a
    market, performance or service condition. Therefore, an entity
    should not classify such an award as a liability if it otherwise
    qualifies for classification in equity. This guidance is
    effective for interim and annual periods beginning on or after
    December&#160;15, 2010 and is to be applied prospectively. The
    Company is evaluating the impact the amendment will have on its
    consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 05 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;3.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">STOCK-BASED
    COMPENSATION</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Share
    option plans</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company&#146;s employees participate in various stock-based
    compensation plans, which are either provided by a principal
    stockholder of the Company or by the Company directly.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Stock-based compensation expense charged to income for the plans
    was $3,563 and $2,816 for the twenty-six weeks ended
    August&#160;1, 2010 and August&#160;2, 2009, respectively. Total
    unrecognized compensation cost as at August&#160;1, 2010 was
    $15,336 for all stock option plans, which is expected to be
    recognized over a weighted-average period of 2.5&#160;years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Company
    stock options and performance stock units</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A summary of the Company&#146;s stock option, performance stock
    unit and restricted share activity as of August&#160;1, 2010 and
    changes during the period then ended is presented below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company&#146;s performance stock units are awarded to
    eligible employees and entitle the grantee to receive up to
    1.5&#160;shares of common stock per performance stock unit if
    the Company achieves specified performance goals and the grantee
    remains employed during the vesting period. The fair value of
    performance stock units is based on the closing price of the
    Company&#146;s common stock on the award date. Expense for
    performance stock units is recognized when it is probable the
    performance goal will be achieved.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stockholder-
    sponsored stock options</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During the thirteen weeks ended August&#160;1, 2010, holders of
    exchangeable shares converted 214 exchangeable shares into
    214&#160;shares of common stock of the Company for no additional
    consideration. In connection with the exchange of exchangeable
    shares, an equal number of outstanding shares of the
    Company&#146;s special voting stock were cancelled.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During the thirteen weeks ended August&#160;1, 2010, there were
    no grants or forfeitures related to any of the stock options
    issued and outstanding under the stockholder-sponsored awards.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    stock purchase plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company&#146;s Employee Stock Purchase Plan
    (&#147;ESPP&#148;) allows for the purchase of common stock of
    the Company by all eligible employees. Eligible employees may
    elect to have whatever portion of his or her base salary
    equates, after deduction of applicable taxes, to either 3%, 6%
    or 9% of his or her base salary withheld during each payroll
    period for purposes of purchasing shares of the Company&#146;s
    common stock under the ESPP. Additionally, the Company or the
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    8
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">lululemon
    athletica inc. and Subsidiaries</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>NOTES&#160;TO THE UNAUDITED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    subsidiary of the Company employing the participant, will make a
    cash contribution as additional compensation to each participant
    equal to one-third of the aggregate amount of that
    participant&#146;s contribution for that pay period, which will
    be used to purchase shares of the Company&#146;s common stock,
    subject to certain limits as defined in the ESPP. The maximum
    number of shares available under the ESPP is 3,000&#160;shares.
    During the quarter ended August&#160;1, 2010, there were
    9&#160;shares purchased under the ESPP, which were funded by the
    Company through open market purchases.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 05 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;4.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">REACQUISITION
    OF FRANCHISED STORES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On May&#160;12, 2010, the Company increased its investment in
    lululemon athletica australia PTY (&#147;lululemon
    australia&#148;) from 13&#160;percent to 80&#160;percent. The
    transaction provides the Company control over lululemon
    australia, which became a subsidiary of the Company on this
    date. lululemon australia is engaged in the distribution of
    healthy lifestyle inspired athletic apparel, which is sold
    through a chain of corporate-owned retail locations and through
    a network of wholesale accounts, in Australia. The Company
    previously accounted for its 13&#160;percent interest in
    lululemon australia as an equity investment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The acquired business contributed net revenues of $3,782 and
    losses from operations of $456 to the Company from the date of
    acquisition to August&#160;1, 2010. The following unaudited pro
    forma summary presents consolidated information of the Company
    as if the business combination had occurred on February&#160;2,
    2009:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 01 -->

    consequential tax effects.

    These expenses are included in general and administrative
    expense in the Company&#146;s consolidated statement of income
    for the first two quarters of fiscal 2010.

</DIV>

    <B>NOTES&#160;TO THE UNAUDITED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Preliminary
    amounts of identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed:
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="91%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As a result of the Company obtaining control over lululemon
    australia, the Company&#146;s previously held 13&#160;percent
    interest was remeasured to fair value, resulting in a gain of
    $1,792. This has been recognized in the line item&#160;Other
    income (expense), net in the consolidated statement of income.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The preliminary fair value of the noncontrolling interest of
    $3,554 in lululemon australia was estimated by applying a market
    approach and an income approach. This fair value measurement is
    based on significant inputs not observable in the market and
    thus represents a Level&#160;3 measurement as defined in
    ASC&#160;820. The fair value estimates use standard valuation
    techniques, including discounted cash flows, comparable
    transactions and internal projections, and include assumed
    adjustments due to the lack of control or lack of marketability
    that market participants would consider when estimating the fair
    value of the noncontrolling interest in lululemon australia.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On July&#160;20, 2010, the Company reacquired in an asset
    purchase transaction a franchised store in Saskatoon,
    Saskatchewan for total cash consideration of $6,610. Included in
    the Company&#146;s consolidated statements of income for the
    unaudited thirteen and twenty-six week periods ended
    August&#160;1, 2010 are the results of the reacquired Saskatoon
    franchised store from the date of acquisition to August&#160;1,
    2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following table summarizes the preliminary fair values of
    the net assets acquired as of August&#160;1, 2010:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The reacquisition of the franchised stores is part of
    management&#146;s vertical retail growth strategy. The
    reacquired franchise rights are amortized on a straight-line
    basis over their estimated useful lives. Reacquired franchise
    rights with indefinite useful lives are reviewed for impairment
    annually, or as events occur or circumstances arise which may
    reduce the fair value of indefinite lived reacquired franchise
    rights below carrying value. These are preliminary values that
    may change as the Company&#146;s fair value assessment is
    ongoing.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;5.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">LEGAL
    PROCEEDINGS</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,body -->
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On April&#160;2, 2009, three former hourly Company employees
    filed a class action lawsuit in San&#160;Diego Superior Court,
    California, entitled Mia Stephens et&#160;al&#160;v. lululemon
    athletica inc. The lawsuit alleges that the Company violated
    various California Labor Code sections by requiring employees to
    wear lululemon clothing during working hours without reimbursing
    such employees for the cost of the clothing and by paying
    certain bonus payments to its employees in the
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    10
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">lululemon
    athletica inc. and Subsidiaries</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>NOTES&#160;TO THE UNAUDITED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    form of lululemon gift cards redeemable only for lululemon
    merchandise. The complaint also alleges that the Company owes
    waiting time penalties as the result of failing to pay employees
    all wages due at the time of termination. The Company and the
    plaintiffs have reached an agreement on settlement terms and the
    agreement has received tentative approval from the court.
    Plaintiffs and the Company must now go through the process of
    obtaining final court approval.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On March&#160;26, 2009, a former hourly Company employee filed a
    class action lawsuit in Orange County Superior Court,
    California, entitled Brett Kohlenberg et&#160;al&#160;v.
    lululemon athletica inc. The lawsuit alleges that the Company
    violated various California Labor Code sections by failing to
    pay its employees for certain rest and meal breaks and &#147;off
    the clock&#148; work, and for penalties related to waiting times
    and failure to provide itemized wage statements. The Company and
    the plaintiffs have reached an agreement on settlement terms and
    the agreement has received tentative approval from the court.
    Plaintiffs and the Company must now go through the process of
    obtaining final court approval.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company is a party to various other legal proceedings
    arising in the ordinary course of its business, but the Company
    is not currently a party to any legal proceeding that management
    believes would have a material adverse effect on the
    Company&#146;s consolidated financial position or results of
    operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 21pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company&#146;s calculation of weighted-average shares
    includes the common stock of the Company as well as the
    exchangeable shares. Exchangeable shares are the equivalent of
    common shares in all material respects. All classes of stock
    have in effect the same rights and share equally in
    undistributed net income. For the twenty-six weeks ended
    August&#160;1, 2010 and August&#160;2, 2009, 64 and 896 stock
    options, respectively, were anti-dilutive to earnings and
    therefore have been excluded from the computation of diluted
    earnings per share.
</DIV>

    <BR>
    11

    <BR>
    12

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">lululemon
    athletica inc. and Subsidiaries</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>NOTES&#160;TO THE UNAUDITED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<!-- XBRL,n -->
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 05 -->

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;8.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SEGMENT
    REPORTING</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,body -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Company reports segments based on the financial information
    it uses in managing its business. Previously, the Company
    reported its franchise channel as an operating segment, however
    it has accounted for less than 10% of net revenue from
    operations in each of fiscal 2009 and fiscal 2008. Opening new
    franchise stores is not a significant part of the Company&#146;s
    near-term growth strategy and the Company does not expect that
    the revenue derived from franchises to be greater than 10% of
    net revenue in future years. Therefore, the Company has
    re-evaluated segment reporting in the first quarter of fiscal
    2010. The Company&#146;s reportable segments are comprised of
    corporate-owned stores, direct to consumer and other. Direct to
    consumer includes sales from the Company&#146;s
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    website and phone sales. Franchise sales, wholesale, showrooms
    sales and outlet sales have been combined into other.
    Information for these segments is detailed in the table below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent"><!-- TABLE 01 -->

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">ITEM&#160;2.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <A name='108'></A><B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">MANAGEMENT&#146;S
    DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF
    OPERATIONS</FONT></I></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-Q</FONT>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our fiscal year ends on the Sunday closest to January 31 of the
    following year, typically resulting in a 52&#160;week year, but
    occasionally gives rise to an additional week, resulting in a
    53&#160;week year. Fiscal 2010 will end on January&#160;30, 2011
    and will be a 52&#160;week year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Overview</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The world economy and capital markets have shown some signs of
    improvement, however, many companies and consumers continue to
    be impacted by uncertainty in the macro-economy. This has proven
    to be challenging for retailers in past periods, where declines
    in comparable store sales were posted. Although our current
    quarter results demonstrate the success of our efforts to
    overcome instability in the economy, the current market
    volatility may still negatively affect our financial results in
    future periods.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We believe that through strong execution of our strategic plans,
    we are well placed to succeed in this market. In fiscal 2009, we
    were able to introduce our new
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    sales channel which has further increased our brand awareness
    and has made our product available in new markets, including
    those outside of North America. In fiscal 2010 we have begun to
    execute a new plan for growth, which includes increasing our
    store base, when and where we see opportunities for success. For
    example, we have opened 16&#160;net new corporate-owned stores
    and 33 net new showrooms in North America and Australia since
    the second quarter of fiscal 2009, including reacquired
    franchises. We believe our strong cash flow generation, solid
    balance sheet and healthy liquidity provide us with the
    financial flexibility to continue executing the initiatives
    which we believe will benefit our company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    While we have committed to investment in stores, people and
    infrastructure enhancements and funding working capital
    requirements in fiscal 2010, we remain conscious of our
    discretionary spending. These expenditures are designed to
    position our business for long-term profitable growth and
    protect our brand integrity. We expect to continually assess the
    economic environment and market conditions to guide our
    decisions regarding our timing of investments.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    14
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Operating
    Segment Overview</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    lululemon is a designer and retailer of technical athletic
    apparel operating primarily in North America and Australia. Our
    yoga-inspired apparel is marketed under the lululemon athletica
    and ivivva athletica brand names. We offer a comprehensive line
    of apparel and accessories including fitness pants, shorts, tops
    and jackets designed for athletic pursuits such as yoga, running
    and general fitness, and dance-inspired apparel for female
    youth. As of August&#160;1, 2010, our branded apparel was
    principally sold through 130 corporate-owned and franchise
    stores that are primarily located in Canada, the United States
    and Australia, and via our retail website through our direct to
    consumer channel. We believe our vertical retail strategy allows
    us to interact more directly with and gain insights from our
    customers while providing us with greater control of our brand.
    For the second quarter of fiscal 2010, approximately 53% of our
    net revenue was derived from sales of our products in Canada,
    44% of our net revenue was derived from the sales of our
    products in the United&#160;States and 3% of our net revenue was
    derived from sales of our products outside of North America.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our net revenue increased from $179.4&#160;million in the first
    two quarters of fiscal 2009 to $290.5&#160;million in the first
    two quarters of fiscal 2010, representing a 62% increase. Our
    ability to open new stores and grow sales in existing stores has
    been driven by increasing demand for our technical athletic
    apparel and a growing recognition of the lululemon athletica
    brand. We believe our superior products, strategic store
    locations, inviting store environment, grassroots marketing
    approach and distinctive corporate culture are responsible for
    our strong financial performance.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We have three reportable segments: corporate-owned stores,
    direct to consumer and other. We report our segments based on
    the financial information we use in managing our businesses.
    While we receive financial information for each corporate-owned
    store, we have aggregated all of the corporate-owned stores into
    one reportable segment due to the similarities in the economic
    and other characteristics of these stores. Our direct to
    consumer segment is an increasingly substantial part of our
    business, representing 7% of our net revenues in the first two
    quarters of fiscal 2010, 4% of our net revenue in fiscal 2009
    and less than 1% of our net revenue in fiscal 2008. Expanding
    this sales channel is a significant part of our near-term growth
    strategy, and we therefore expect the revenue derived from our
    direct to consumer sales to comprise more than 10% of the net
    revenue we report in future fiscal years. Our other operations,
    which include franchise sales, wholesale, showrooms sales and
    outlet sales, accounted for less than 10% of our net revenues
    from continuing operations in each of the first two quarters of
    fiscal 2010, fiscal 2009 and fiscal 2008. We previously reported
    our franchise channel as an operating segment; however, opening
    new franchise stores is not a significant part of our near-term
    store growth strategy, and as such we expect net revenue from
    our franchise stores to continue to decrease, including as a
    percentage of total net revenue, in future years.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    15
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Results
    of Operations</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Thirteen
    Week Results</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Net
    Revenue</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Net revenue increased $54.5&#160;million, or 56%, to
    $152.2&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from
    $97.7&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2009.
    Assuming the average exchange rate between the Canadian and
    United States dollars for the second quarter of fiscal 2009
    remained constant, our net revenue would have increased
    $47.6&#160;million, or 49%, for the second quarter of fiscal
    2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The net revenue increase was driven by increased sales at
    locations in our comparable stores base, sales from new stores
    and showrooms opened, sales from franchised stores that were
    reacquired during the quarter and the growth of our
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    website sales included in our direct to consumer segment. The
    constant dollar increase in comparable store sales was driven
    primarily by the strength of our existing product lines, our
    successful introduction of new products and increasing
    recognition of the lululemon athletica brand name, especially at
    our U.S.&#160;stores.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our net revenue on a segment basis for the thirteen week periods
    ended August&#160;1, 2010 and August&#160;2, 2009 are expressed
    in dollar amounts as well as relevant percentages, presented as
    a percentage of total net revenue below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    16
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Corporate-Owned Stores.</I>&#160;&#160;Net revenue from our
    corporate-owned stores segment increased $44.4&#160;million, or
    52%, to $129.4&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2010
    from $85.1&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2009.
    The following contributed to the $44.4&#160;million increase in
    net revenue from our corporate-owned stores segment:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Comparable store sales increase of 31% in the second quarter of
    fiscal 2010 resulted in a $25.6&#160;million increase to net
    revenue, excluding the effect of foreign currency fluctuations.
    Including the effect of foreign currency fluctuations,
    comparable store sales increased 38%, or $31.1&#160;million, in
    the second quarter of fiscal 2010;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Net revenue from corporate-owned stores we opened subsequent to
    August&#160;2, 2009, and therefore not included in the
    comparable store sales growth, contributed $13.3&#160;million of
    the increase. Net new store openings since the second quarter of
    fiscal 2009 included three stores in Canada (including the
    Saskatoon franchised store that was reacquired), ten stores in
    the United States, and nine stores in Australia (including nine
    franchised stores that were reacquired).
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Direct to Consumer.</I>&#160;&#160;Net revenue from our
    direct to consumer segment increased $6.6&#160;million, or 218%,
    to $9.6&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from
    $3.0&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2009. The
    increase was a result of net revenue from our
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    website, which was launched towards the end of the first quarter
    of fiscal 2009. Prior to the launch of our
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    website, our direct to consumer segment consisted only of phone
    sales.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Other.</I>&#160;&#160;Net revenue from our other segment
    increased $3.5&#160;million, or 37%, to $13.1&#160;million in
    the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from $9.6&#160;million in the
    second quarter of fiscal 2009. There were increases in net
    revenues across most of our operating channels included in our
    other segment: wholesale, showrooms and outlets. Net revenues
    from our franchise channel decreased due to our reacquisition of
    ten franchised stores in Australia and Canada. Our other segment
    continues to grow year over year through new showroom and outlet
    locations, new wholesale partners and net revenue growth at
    existing locations attributable to a strong product offering and
    brand interest. We continue to employ our other segment strategy
    to increase interest in our product in markets we have not
    otherwise entered with corporate-owned stores.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Gross
    Profit</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Gross profit increased $35.1&#160;million, or 78%, to
    $80.3&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from
    $45.2&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2009.
    Increased net revenues as well as a strengthening Canadian
    dollar relative to the U.S.&#160;dollar improved product margin
    in all of our operating segments, and ultimately resulted in an
    increased gross profit.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The increase in gross profit was partially offset by increases
    in fixed costs, such as occupancy costs and depreciation, as
    well as increased costs related to our production, design,
    distribution and merchandising departments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Gross profit as a percentage of net revenue, or gross margin,
    increased by 660&#160;basis points, to 52.8% in the second
    quarter of fiscal 2010 from 46.2% in the second quarter of
    fiscal 2009. The increase in gross margin resulted primarily
    from:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    a decrease in fixed costs, such as occupancy costs and
    depreciation, relative to the increase in net revenue, which had
    a leveraging effect on gross margin and contributed to an
    increase in gross margin of 260&#160;basis points;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an improvement in the Canadian dollar, relative to the
    U.S.&#160;dollar, decreased foreign exchange impacts on product
    costs and contributed to an increase in gross margin of
    220&#160;basis points;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in corporate-owned stores, direct to consumer and
    other product margins, which contributed to an increase in gross
    margin of 210&#160;basis points as a result of improved product
    costing on our summer merchandise.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The increases were partially offset by an increase in discounts
    relative to net revenue compared to discounts in the second
    quarter of fiscal 2009. Our other expenses including those
    related to our production, design, distribution and
    merchandising departments, remained constant relative to the
    increase in net revenue, and had no significant impact on gross
    margin.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our cost of goods sold in the second quarter of fiscal 2010 and
    fiscal 2009 included $0.4&#160;million and $0.2&#160;million,
    respectively, of stock-based compensation.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    17
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Selling,
    General and Administrative Expenses</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Selling, general and administrative expenses increased
    $15.2&#160;million, or 49%, to $46.1&#160;million in the second
    quarter of fiscal 2010 from $30.8&#160;million in the second
    quarter of fiscal 2009. The $15.2&#160;million increase in
    selling, general and administrative expenses was principally
    comprised of:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in employee costs of $5.0&#160;million as we
    experience natural growth in labor hours associated with new
    corporate-owned stores, showrooms and outlets and growth at
    existing locations;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in variable administrative costs related to our
    direct to consumer segment, primarily associated with revenue
    growth in this segment, of $3.1&#160;million;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in other costs, including occupancy costs,
    depreciation and distribution not included in cost of goods
    sold, of $2.7&#160;million as a result of the expansion of our
    business;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in head office employee costs, including options
    expense and management incentive-based compensation, of
    $2.2&#160;million incurred in order to position us for long-term
    growth;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in administrative costs related to our Australian
    business, in which we increased our investment significantly in
    the second quarter of fiscal 2010, of $1.7&#160;million;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    an increase in professional fees of $0.4&#160;million, which
    includes consulting fees for recruiting and information systems.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As a percentage of net revenue, selling, general and
    administrative expenses decreased 140&#160;basis points, to
    30.2% in the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from 31.6% in the
    second quarter of fiscal 2009. This improvement was largely due
    to leverage associated with increased net revenues.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our selling, general and administrative expenses in the second
    quarter of fiscal 2010 and fiscal 2009 included
    $1.5&#160;million and $1.2&#160;million, respectively, of
    stock-based compensation expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Income
    from Operations</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income from operations increased $19.9&#160;million, or 139%, to
    $34.2&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from
    $14.3&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2009. The
    increase was a result of increased gross profit of
    $35.1&#160;million, partially offset by increased selling,
    general and administrative costs of $15.2&#160;million. The
    increase in selling, general and administrative costs was
    primarily driven by the increase in our business, as seen in our
    net revenue increases.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On a segment basis, we determine income from operations without
    taking into account our general corporate expenses such as
    corporate employee costs, travel expenses and corporate rent.
    For purposes of our management&#146;s analysis of our financial
    results, we have allocated some general product expenses to our
    corporate-owned stores segment. For example, all expenses
    related to our production, design, distribution and
    merchandising departments have been allocated to this segment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Income from operations (before general corporate expenses) for
    the thirteen weeks ended August&#160;1, 2010 and August&#160;2,
    2009 are expressed in dollar amounts as well as percentages,
    presented as a percentage of net revenue of their respective
    operating segments below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="71%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="4%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="4%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=body -->

<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Corporate-Owned Stores.</I>&#160;&#160;Net income from our
    corporate-owned stores segment increased $20.8&#160;million, or
    80%, to $44.4&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2010
    from $23.5&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2009
    primarily due to an increase of $32.8&#160;million in gross
    profit, which was offset partially by a natural increase in
    selling, general and
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    18
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    administrative expenses related to employee costs as well as
    operating expenses associated with new stores and net revenue
    growth at existing stores.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Direct to Consumer.</I>&#160;&#160;Net income from our direct
    to consumer segment increased $1.6&#160;million, or 135%, to
    $2.8&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from
    $1.2&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2009. Prior
    to the launch of our
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    website, our direct to consumer segment consisted only of phone
    sales. The addition of our
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    website towards the end of the first quarter of fiscal 2009 has
    driven the increase in income from operations for our direct to
    consumer segment. Income from operations as a percentage of
    direct to consumer revenues decreased in the second quarter of
    fiscal 2010 compared to the second quarter of fiscal 2009 due to
    the introduction of promotional shipping.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Other.</I>&#160;&#160;Net income from our other segment
    increased $0.5&#160;million, or 17%, to $3.3&#160;million for
    the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from $2.8&#160;million for the
    second quarter of fiscal 2009. Gross profit related to our other
    segment increased $0.7&#160;million in the second quarter of
    fiscal 2010 from the second quarter of fiscal 2009 primarily due
    to a higher proportion of full margin sales channels in the
    current period, such as our showroom sales channel, than in the
    same period of last year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Other
    Income (Expense), Net</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Other Income (Expense), Net increased $2.1&#160;million, or
    9144%, to $2.1&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2010
    from $0.1&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2009. The
    increase was primarily a result of re-measuring our
    13&#160;percent non-controlling equity investment in Australia
    immediately before obtaining control of the same business.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Provision
    for Income Taxes</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Provision for income taxes increased $9.5&#160;million, or 186%,
    to $14.6&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from
    $5.1&#160;million in the second quarter of fiscal 2009. In the
    second quarter of fiscal 2010, our effective tax rate was 40.3%
    compared to 35.6% in the second quarter of fiscal 2009. The
    increase in the effective tax rate was primarily a result of
    recording a deferred tax liability of $3.1&#160;million in the
    second quarter of fiscal 2010 for estimated future income taxes
    and foreign withholding taxes attributable to the undistributed
    earnings of Canadian subsidiaries which are in excess of our
    reinvestment plans for those subsidiaries.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Net
    Income</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Net income increased $12.5&#160;million to $21.7&#160;million
    for the second quarter of fiscal 2010 from $9.2&#160;million for
    the second quarter of fiscal 2009. The increase in net income of
    $12.5&#160;million for the second quarter of fiscal 2010 was a
    result of an increase in gross profit of $35.1&#160;million
    resulting from decreased product costs, including improved
    foreign exchange differences, and an increase in Other Income
    (Expense), Net of $2.1&#160;million, offset by increases in
    selling, general and administrative expenses of
    $15.2&#160;million and an increase of $9.5&#160;million in
    provision for income taxes.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    19
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 89%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Twenty-Six
    Week Results</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following table summarizes key components of our results of
    operations for the twenty-six week periods ended August&#160;1,
    2010 and August&#160;2, 2009. The operating results are
    expressed in dollar amounts as well as relevant percentages,
    presented as a percentage of net revenue.
</DIV>
